column4: hi everyone.... so I need to figure out how to mount a hard drive....
I have a raid array that doesn't seem to be being detected...
any kernel messages?
and "mount /dev/sda1 /mnt" or whatever doesn't work?
you might try "dmesg | grep -i raid" and see what device name turns up
it greps the log printed at boot for any output regarding a raid array. this could tell you what device name the kernel is using to refer to the device
how have you configured this raid? describe the device
and this raid is connected to your computer how?
so you have a separate sata card plugged into the machine, or?
and the device driver module is loaded in the kernel?
do you know the device driver name? which make is the raid controller?
you'll need to be sure :-)
right, but the controller should have a chipset, which should be listed in your motherboard manual
k, you'll need to do some googling and figure out which driver is needed for this controller chipset
just "NVIDIA mediashield linux ubuntu" should turn up some hits
running the .exe won't do you any good, i'm afraid
but if you can find the driver name in linux, it's probably already supported
let me see what i can dig up. also, be sure to include my handle if you want me to read your future replies
i need more information
what was the name again, mediaguard?
k, i'll ahve a look
are you sure medaishield is the name of the chipset from the motherboard?

unfortunately i'm out of time at the moment, and i can't dig up a device driver name. i suggest you look through the drivers in /lib/modules/ and see if you can find something similar to what is listed in your documentation, and then load that with insmod <filename>
good luck to you
